name: Cookbook-hs
body:
## Cookbook Library
Cookbook is a tiered general-purpose library. It builds upon itself to create an extensive pool of functions to choose from. Cookbook contains functions ranging from highly generic (i.e, ([a] -> a -> [a] and [a] -> [a] -> [a] working on the same function) to very specific, like Quill2, the database language API with type safety.

Sound interesting? Here's some examples.

`after "field:item" ':'` => `"item"` 
 
`after "field:item" "d:" => `"item"` 
 
`splitOn "field,field,field" '.'` => `["field","field","field"]` 

`contains "field" 'e'` => `True`  

`encompassing "field{field{field{x}}}" ('{','}')` => `"field{field{x}}"`

`import Cookbook.*.Meta` => Import all modules in that branch

## Cookbook Map

* Meta
* Essential
  * Meta
  * Common.hs     (Cm)
  * Continuous.hs (Ct)
  * IO.hs         (Io)
* Ingredients
* Meta
  * Functional
        * Meta
	* Break.hs (Br)
  * Lists
        * Meta
	* Access.hs    (Ac)
	* Encompass.hs (En)
	* Modify.hs    (Md)
	* Stats.hs     (St)
  * Tupples
        * Meta
	* Assemble.hs (As)
	* Look.hs     (Lk)
* Recipes
  * Meta
  * Algorithm.hs      (Ag)
  * Cline.hs          (Cl)
  * DataStructures.hs (Ds)
  * Math.hs           (Ma)
  * Sanitize.hs       (Sn)
  * WordStats.hs      (Ws)
* Project
  * Configuration
	* Configuration.hs (Cf)
	* Configuration.std
  * Preprocess
	* Preprocess.hs (Pp)
	* Preprocess.std
  * Quill
	* Quill.hs (Qu)
	* Quill2
          * Meta
	  * Q2Prelude (Q2p)
	  * Q2Parse   (Q2r)
	  * Q2Api     (Q2A)
	  * Q2Io      (Q2Io)
	  * Q2.std
	* Quill.std

## Ports
Cookbook has active ports to D and Lisp, which in the next development cycle will be brought to the same level of Cookbook-hs.

Cookbook-lisp: [Github](https://github.com/natepisarski/cookbook-lisp)  
Cookbook-D: [Github](https://github.com/natepisarski/cookbook-d) 

## Get Cookbook  

Cookbook can be installed easiest via the **cabal** command-line program. [Hackage page](http://hackage.haskell.org/package/cookbook)

`cabal install cookbook`

It has a Debian package wrapper in the repository that will call the cabal program for you, for easy installation via gdebi or a similar program. If none of these options work, it can be installed manually by the clone URL.

### Clone cookbook

`git clone https://github.com/natepisarski/cookbook-hs`
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
